column5: Yes, you read right, there is still none o' the white stuff here. Oh, sure we got some the other day, but it rained and it all melted.
One thing me mudder always wanted in the winter, was a white christmas day. Living in Etobicoke, those were far between. Guess thats why they moved up north. She hasent been disappointed since.
Come on up here for a visit......I was out chasin grouse today with snowshoes on!!!  Friggen stuff is deeper than I thought in the woods!!!  Sinker
Silly, NEWF,you are. LOL  I use a 22 short.
My lawn is white! And ice in the driveway, want some?
You'd never get a shot at these birds here Brian.......they take off before you can even see them. I got one shot off, and no bird to show for it.  The rackets sure came in handy though
Not a term, I have heard in some years. Many Im sure, would think you were playing birdie.LOL
Ya both gotta go back to the Rock for some spruce grouse.  They literally are too easy.  No fear of humans and you can even catch them bare handed if yer quick LOL!
My old man just waits until they fly into the bay window  He's got his limit in the freezer.......who says grouse are smart?

I love living here in Toronto. I grew up on the Rock, I have allready cleared my share of freekin snow. Living next to the Neuc plant keeps the snow away,  Dont worry, we will be getting hit hard from Buffalo winds coming across the lake soon enough.
Where do Grouse get thier little tiny snowshoes from???
